newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada leading indicator rises 0.5 pct in July.
newsitem.headline: Canada leading indicator rises 0.5 pct in July.

text.p: The Canadian composite leading indicator rose 0.5 percent in July to 179.1 (base 1981) after a revised 0.5 percent rise in June to 178.2, Statistics Canada said on Wednesday.

The indicator foreshadows economic activity by tabulating figures for sectors that rise or fall in advance of broader movements in the economy. The figure is "smoothed", reflecting a moving average of approximately the past five months.
The unsmoothed index, reflecting the past month only, rose 0.8 percent in the month to 180.9.
A Reuter survey of economists had forecast the smoothed index to rise 0.5 percent.
(For more information from Statistics Canada, contact Francine Roy at 613 951-3627 or Dominique Perusse at 613-951-1789 with the Current Economic Analysis Division.)
